contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=July 2008}} '''Benedict Jablonski''', aka '''Ben Jason'''(c. 1917 – May 15, 2003) was a longtime [[science fiction]] fan and booster who co-designed the [[Hugo Award]] based on a [[rocket]]-shaped hood ornament from an [[Oldsmobile 88]]. He was also chairman of the 1966 World Science Fiction Convention in Cleveland, [[Ohio]] at which [[Gene Roddenberry]] previewed the two-hour pilot of his new series, "[[Star Trek]]", for science fiction fans. He died May 15, 2003 in [[Ohio]] at the age of 86. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Jablonski, Benedict | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Science fiction fan | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 2003 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jablonski, Benedict}} [[Category:Science fiction fans]] [[Category:1910s births]] [[Category:2003 deaths]] {{sf-stub}} {{US-bio-stub}}
